author: Declan Solomon
title: Introduction to Backend Development
content: Backend development, often called server-side development, involves creating the behind-the-scenes functionality of applications, including databases, server logic, and APIs, which manage data and power the user-facing frontend. It acts as the core engine for user authentication, data storage, and business logic, ensuring secure and efficient performance.

author: Sola Nnamdi
title: Blockchain 101: An Introductory Guide
content: Blockchain is a decentralized, distributed, and immutable digital ledger that records transactions across a network of computers, ensuring data security and transparency without the need for intermediaries like banks. It links data in chronological, cryptographic `blocks`, making tampering nearly impossible. Primarily used for cryptocurrencies and secure, transparent data sharing, it reduces fraud and costs.
